conclusion: Use principles of mechanics, specifically principle of moments and law of moments
Block A is suspended from a rope inclined at 30°, block B is suspended from a pulley with a 90° angle
Identify given information: Angle of inclination of slope is 30°, angle of rope on both sides of pulley is 90°, mass of block A is m, mass of pulley is negligible
Since block A is stationary, sum of moments about pivot point is zero
Moment about pivot point for block A is m times angle A equals mass of block B times angle B
Substitute known values into equation: m times 30° equals mass of block B times 90°
Solve for mass of block B: mass of block B equals m times 30° divided by 90°
Calculate mass of block B: mass of block B equals m divided by 3
Since mass of block B is m divided by 3, the mass of block B is m divided by 3
The mass of block B is m divided by 3
